name: Sha Ka Ree
description: The catalyst for Spock's quest to erase himself from Starfleet history appears to be an old flame: Leila Kalomi, botanist of Omicron Ceti III. But is Leila acting alone? Put an end to Spock's misguided actions once and for all!
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Kalomi, Zarabeth, Sybok, Vulcans or EV Suit Spock, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the USS Enterprise A, D'deridex Warbird, or Terran Empire Constellation Class will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Kalomi, Zarabeth, Sybok, Vulcans or EV Suit Spock

featured_crew.name: Zarabeth
featured_crew.flavor: Trapped alone five thousand years in the past, Zarabeth falls for a surprise visitor: Spock.

featured_crew.name: Sybok
featured_crew.flavor: A Vulcan iconoclast, Sybok embraced emotion and sought to find the paradise planet of Sha Ka Ree.

next_threshold_rewards.name: Credits
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

screens.text: "If you would hold someone to account for my actions, it should be me alone. I have restricted disruption to my own Starfleet career, but I will not hesitate to expand if you threaten Leila--Miss Kalomi."

"Spock, please, we have nothing to be ashamed of. Starfleet has forced you to suppress your humanity, let Vulcan logic rob you of a full life. We're going to get those stolen years back. Spock's going to see that he is capable of love--without help from spores."
"My brother, you have shared your pain with me. I will help you finish what you started, so you can finally be happy with Leila. The Captain can give me no orders--I am free, as you soon will be."
"Captain, I would do anything to see Spock happy. But Sybok and Leila aren't thinking of his happiness--only their own."

"Sybok manipulated them both. He approached me, first, thinking I could get Spock to do this, for me. But I wouldn't. I've learned about Starfleet, and Spock's career. He can't give that up, not for me, not for Leila--not for anyone."

responses.text: "Do you really think anyone is buying this, Sybok?"
"Zarabeth, do you think you can get through to Spock?"
"I'm sure Starfleet would have survived without Spock."

screens.text: "I thought you were Spock's true love. I see now you are only a criminal, desperate to ensure you are never exiled again."
"Why so skeptical, Captain? Because I could have benefited from not having a brother in Starfleet, at one point in my life?"

"But would Spock have survived without Starfleet? Everyone keeps pointing out his struggle, being half-Vulcan, and half-human. Well, where do you think he met most of his human acquaintances? Where did he experience love, loss, sorrow, and joy?"

"Everyone who loves Spock has Starfleet to thank, for making him the man he is. And real love means doing what's best for that person, not yourself. I think I can remind Spock and Leila of that, if Sybok doesn't get in the way."
